column4: Recent research is trying to figure out how to make images accessible.
column10: Can we see any direct evidence of the oregonic process being described? If so, that should be concisely described.
column29: poetic, but out of place here
column57: Does not describe how materials are used or what kind of building. SOmehow wordy and still irrelevant.
column64: How does it relate to sculpture, at all?
column76:
Wish I didn't have to scroll past two instances of the image description in each page of this survey. If I needed a reminder i could scroll right back up :-)
Some responses you're getting that the image isn't super relevant may stem from the fact that the image (not the description) was a poor choice. So keep that in mind when parsing results
column82: Do we see stratification, if so how so?
column85: The first question on each page is actually impossible to answer if you are Blind. I don't have the source image. I only have the description. So, it's Schrodinger's Alt Text over here. Maybe the Alt text is as relevant as it can be given an irrelevant or confusing image .. or maybe the Alt text is missing pivotal info. No way to know. I hope I'm not the only person noticing this paradox
column91: Styles of the forniture, lighting etc? Concise but evocative would be nice here.
column93: no reference to interior design concepts at all
column94: OK, so the question on "anything irrelevant" forces me to choose "no, just right" if there's nothing extra and irrelevant, even if there's nothing relevant either. I'm choosing "just right" at the same time tthat I'm rating these images poorly in other categories. Maybe next time relevance is a five-point or nine-point scale with perfection in the middle??
column102: No focus on salient content, the ads. Unnecessary to count the heads; could have been more concie.
column121: I too am a fretted instrument at this point. Without the source image, it's hard to know if other salient features (e.g. presence of an amplifier) are missing from the alt text ...
column130: Going grey at this point  in the survey
column136: Any particular relational positioning, pointing, etc that could concisely signify co-operation here?
column145: How detailed, realistic/abstracted? Maybe each of the 3 shows a different level of realism/abstraction? That would be good to know in this context
column163: Any cuisine pictured other than the turkey?
column176: Light, the occasional crosswalk stripes, not anything useful for parsing photos
column177: Always (More than 95% of the time you use computers)
column183: Feedback is already in-line with questions where it occurred. Happy to chat to follow up if that's helpful.
